snippet: Mr. Love, with his musical partner, the trumpeter Wayne Jackson, added blast to songs by Otis Redding, Aretha Franklin and many others.
abstract: Andrew Love, a tenor saxophonist who as half of the Memphis Horns helped define what came to be known as the Memphis sound, dies at age 70.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Love, with his musical partner, the trumpeter Wayne Jackson, added blast to songs by Otis Redding, Aretha Franklin and many others.

headline.seo: Andrew Love, Saxophonist With the Memphis Horns, Dies at 70
headline.main: Andrew Love, Tenor Saxophonist for the Memphis Horns, Dies at 70
headline.print_headline: Andrew Love, 70, Tenor Saxophonist for the Memphis Horns
